message:
For Go enthusiasts, or for people working with streaming textual data, I would recommend experimenting with Go's encoding/gob:
https://golang.org/pkg/encoding/gob/

It's really very simply to use. It can encode any type of data, transform it to a stream of bytes, then you can do whatever you want with it (either send it over a network or save it to a file in a streamable fashion).
story: Ahmed Aboshanab shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: gob - The Go Programming Language
caption: golang.org
description: Package gob manages streams of gobs - binary values exchanged between an Encoder (transmitter) and a Decoder (receiver). A typical use is transporting arguments and results of remote procedure calls (RPCs) such as those provided by package "rpc".
